p: V2 development is not finished yet, this page is just a preview of the upcoming documentation.
SNCF.JS is a JavaScript library that allows you to easily use the SNCF api.
You can install Retype using npm or yarn.
All operating systems are supported, including Mac, Windows, and Linux.
Copy .env.backup to .env and fill the token in the file.
SNCF.JS is object oriented which makes its use simple, fast and efficient
SNCF.js is optimized to the maximum, and will soon have a caching system limiting the requests
Installation takes only a few seconds because the package is very light.
A bug, a request, need help? Do not hesitate to ask, we will be happy to answer you in the smallest details
A technical support that listens, efficient and fast, join the Discussions.
If you find a defect or would like to submit a feature request, please create an Issue and we will investigate right away.
Do you have a general inquiry? Please feel free to contact me on instagram.
defines the start date of the disruptions to search for
defines the end date of the disruptions to search for
The number of disruptions to get
The id of the disruption to get
Search a line by name (departure - arrival)
Search for a place by name
The name of the station to search for
The filters to apply to the search
The id of the station to get
Return boolean if the train is in late
Return boolean if the train is in late
Get the vehicles of the line at a given time
defines the start date to search for vehicles
defines the end date to search for vehicles
The number of vehicles to get
Get the stop areas of the line
Get the departure of the line at a given time
defines the start date to search departures
defines the end date to search departures
The number of departures to get
Get the arrivals of the line at a given time
defines the start date to search arrivals
defines the end date to search arrivals
The number of arrivals to get
